name: Stranded God
description:
Build up a small Town and defend it from the evil Goblins!

You are stranded on a goblin-controlled  island, completely forgotten by the human people. Alone and with no real hope for survival you stumble upon a suspicious looking scarecrow, which turns out to embody a human god, who was recently trapped on this island. As it turns out, they need your help just as much as you need theirs, so you work together to defend yourselves against the goblins.

  • Explore the goblin-infested island and gather resources
  • Construct different buildings as you expand your small town
  • Let your god create people, which you can recruit to extend your own army
  • Defend your town against nightly attacks from the goblins
  • SHEEP
Controls

For the best experience, playing with a gamepad is recommended, but keyboard controls are of course also supported.

If you don't hear any sounds, check your PC's sound output settings. When connecting a gamepad, your PC might change the output device to the gamepad's speakers, which don't work like that.

Versions

This is mainly a game for Windows, but for those who don't want to download anything there is a browser version. It should work decently well most browsers (mainly Chrome and Edge), though there are at least few problems with this version.

Known Issues:

  • Most particle effects refuse to show up in the browser
  • Gamepads are sometimes not recognized properly, leading to the wrong buttons being displayed and recognized
  • In Firefox, gamepad controls don't really work at all

If you have performance issues, control issues or any other troubles with the browser version, the Windows version is available to download for free. For the best and most stable experience, the Windows version is highly recommended.

If you enjoy the game, you can show your support by leaving a positive rating or giving feedback in the comments.

If you really like what I do and want to support me further, you can leave a small donation, but please keep in mind that this is entirely optional.

Support of any kind is greatly appreciated!

Credits
  • Pixel Art by Pixel Frog: Tiny Swords
  • Music by alkakrab: Fantasy RPG Music, Fantasy RPG Music Vol. 2
  • Character Voices by John Carroll: Orc Voice Pack
  • Non-Combat and Explosion SFX by GameSupplyGuy: Classic Workshop SFX, 1000+ Nintendo Sound Effects
  • Combat SFX by Leohpaz: Minifantasy Dungeon SFX Pack

Everything else, including Concept, Game Design, Systems Design and Programming, is done by me (Ulbo Games).
